Package Overview¶

modulesApplication.csv.csvForm¶

class modulesApplication.csv.csvForm.CsvUploadForm(data=None, files=None, auto_id='id_%s', prefix=None, initial=None, error_class=<class 'django.forms.utils.ErrorList'>, label_suffix=None, empty_permitted=False, field_order=None, use_required_attribute=None, renderer=None)¶

modulesApplication.csv.csv_reader¶

class modulesApplication.csv.csv_reader.CsvReader¶

Bases: object

A CsvReader to read in data from a csv file. The CsvReader can read headers from a csv file, as well as rows, and return a list of Model objects according to the type that was read in.

read_dict(file)¶

Read a csv file and return a list of dicts. :param file the csv file to read :return: a list of dicts of header/value pairs

read_headers(filename)¶

Reads the headers of the csv file. :param filename: the path of the file to read. :return: the headers from the csv file.

read_table(filepath, model_class: django.db.models.base.ModelBase)¶

Read ALL HEADERS from a csv file corresponding to one database table into a list of Model objects. :param filepath: the path of the csv file to read. :param model_class: the type of Model to read in :return: A list of Model objects.

read_table_partial(filepath, model_class)¶

Read from a csv file into a model, reading only those headers which the model has as a field and no more. :param filepath: the path of the csv file :param model_class: the target model class :return: a list of model objects
